item.description:
Time Approximate. Specific Start time to be posted when announced.

BEESWAX revolves around the personal and professional entanglements of twin sisters living in Austin, Texas. Jeannie co-owns a vintage clothing store with Amanda, a semi-estranged friend who she fears is trying to end their partnership. Lauren leads a looser, less tethered existence and is considering getting out of the country altogether. When Jeannie receives an email from Amanda threatening lawsuit, she calls her law student ex-boyfriend Merrill for help. Eager for distraction from his own problems, he begins to help the sisters with theirs.

dir. Andrew Bujalski w/ Tilly Hatcher, Maggie Hatcher, Alex Karpovsky 1h40m

From the New York Times Critics' Pick Review:

The title of “Beeswax,” Andrew Bujalski’s third feature, evokes the sticky medium of social insects and also the idioms of childhood speech. “It’s none of your beeswax,” say the queen bees on the playground, and just what is or isn’t someone else’s business is one of the questions Mr. Bujalski and his characters explore.
More About This Movie

Another is the boundary between the grown-up world of real business — that hive of money, work and legal obligation — and the ostensibly less frenzied, more loosely organized realm of family and friends.

BEESWAX was awarded a Special Jury Prize at this year's IFF Boston Film Festival.

Following the film, we will get into each other's business at Zaftigs, but just know that what I order is none of your Beeswax . .

See you at the movie,

John
item.name: Beeswax (2009)
